page.title: 05Wigan Homes for the Aged
page.content: Next door to school is Hindley House a home for 25 old people of 60 and over. It opened in 1968 and has a waiting list of people wanting to get in. A warden is in charge of people aged 61- 84. The building suffers from vandal- ism. Also badly behaved children frighten the old people by climbing on their fire-escape and shouting loudly. Further along the road is St. Clements Court, a collection of sheltered accom- modation flats. Jamie's mum works there. People stay independent paying a weekly rent and have their own keys and door. Ladies are over 60, men over 65. The eldest resident is 87. Flats have both a lift and stairs and are protected from vandals. A warden is on hand to help when needed. Old people like living here. Alison, Yvonne, Sarah, Jamie and Neil Aged 9.
